meanings.sent1: The buccaneer sailed the seas in search of treasure.
meanings.sent2: The buccaneer's flag struck fear into the hearts of sailors.
meanings.sent3: The buccaneer's parrot always squawked at the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: The buccaneer's eye patch added to his mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The buccaneer's sword gleamed in the moonlight as he boarded the ship.

meanings.definition: To engage in piracy or plundering.
meanings.sent1: The pirates decided to buccaneer the merchant ship under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: In the old days, sailors would often buccaneer for riches and adventure.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to buccaneer in the backyard, using sticks as swords.
meanings.sent4: The thieves planned to buccaneer the museum and steal the priceless artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The group of outlaws set out to buccaneer along the coast, looking for unsuspecting victims.
